intro: Epilobium subcoriaceum, commonly known as rough willowherb, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as wet meadows and streambanks. The plant has opposite, hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, pink to purple flowers in clusters. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it is often found in wetland ecosystems. Epilobium subcoriaceum is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
